questions.text: When a team member makes a mistake that delays the project, what should the Servant Leader do first?

options.C: Meet with them privately to understand the root cause and coach them

questions.explanation: Mindset: Never fire or punish. Coach and mentor. Understand the root cause.

questions.text: A stakeholder demands a change to the scope immediately. What is the Project Manager's first step?

options.A: Reject the request because the scope is baseline
options.B: Implement the change to keep them happy
options.C: Analyze the impact of the change on constraints

questions.explanation: Mindset: Always analyze/assess the impact before acting or saying yes/no.

questions.text: The team is arguing about which technology to use. The debate is delaying the sprint. What should the Servant Leader do?

options.A: Decide for them to save time
options.B: Facilitate a collaborative session to help them reach a consensus

questions.explanation: Mindset: Facilitate collaboration. Don't dictate, but don't ignore impediments.

questions.text: You are a PM on a hybrid project. A key deliverable is failing quality tests. What do you do?

options.B: Review the Quality Management Plan and inspection results to find the root cause
options.C: Add more time to the schedule
options.D: Tell the team to work harder

questions.explanation: Mindset: Review the plan, find the root cause. Don't just react.

questions.text: In an Agile environment, who prioritizes the Product Backlog?
questions.explanation: Mindset: Know the roles. PO owns value and prioritization.

questions.text: A vendor is late with a critical delivery. What is the first thing you should do?

options.C: Meet with the vendor to understand the delay and discuss options

questions.explanation: Mindset: Communication and problem-solving first. Legal action is a last resort.

questions.text: Your team is distributed across three time zones and communication is suffering. What is the best solution?

options.C: Schedule a daily video conference at a time convenient for everyone

questions.explanation: Mindset: Face-to-face (video) is better than text. Find a common ground.

questions.text: A team member comes to you with a personal problem affecting their work. What do you do?

options.A: Tell them to leave personal issues at home
options.B: Listen with empathy and offer support (Emotional Intelligence)

questions.explanation: Mindset: Be a Servant Leader. Use Emotional Intelligence.

questions.text: The customer is unhappy with the product increment. What should have been done differently?

options.B: More frequent demos and feedback loops

questions.explanation: Mindset: Agile promotes frequent feedback to ensure value delivery.

questions.text: You identify a new risk that could derail the project. What is the immediate next step?

options.B: Update the Risk Register and analyze the risk

questions.explanation: Mindset: Document and Analyze first.

questions.text: What is the primary goal of the Project Manager?
questions.explanation: Mindset: Value is King. Plans and costs support value delivery.

questions.text: The team feels burnt out from overtime. The sponsor wants to crash the schedule further. What do you do?

options.B: Protect the team and negotiate with the sponsor, explaining the impact on quality and morale

questions.explanation: Mindset: Servant Leader protects the team. Sustainable pace.

questions.text: Two senior stakeholders have conflicting requirements. Who resolves this?

options.C: You facilitate a meeting for them to resolve it

questions.explanation: Mindset: Facilitate resolution. Don't take sides or guess.

questions.text: During the Daily Standup, a member starts discussing a complex technical issue. What should the Scrum Master do?

options.B: Take it 'offline' (Parking Lot) to keep the meeting under 15 minutes
options.D: Write it down for the Retrospective

questions.explanation: Mindset: Keep ceremonies effective. Respect the timebox.

questions.text: Which document is a 'living document' that is updated throughout the project?
questions.explanation: Mindset: Continuous improvement. Lessons learned are gathered continuously.

questions.text: If a question asks 'what do you do first?', you should look for an answer that involves:
questions.explanation: Mindset: Review/Assess/Analyze is almost always the first step.

questions.text: A team member is not performing well. You have already coached them, but there is no improvement. What is the LAST resort?
questions.explanation: Mindset: Protect the project. If coaching fails repeatedly, removal is a last resort.

questions.text: What is the best way to ensure quality in an Agile project?

options.C: A large QA team at the end

questions.explanation: Mindset: Quality is built-in, not inspected in at the end.

questions.text: The sponsor asks for a status report. You should provide:

options.C: Work Performance Information (analyzed data) tailored to their needs
options.D: Nothing, they can check the dashboard

questions.explanation: Mindset: Communicate effectively. Information, not just data.

questions.text: Your project is behind schedule. The team suggests cutting out the 'Testing' phase to catch up. You should:

options.B: Reject the idea; quality is not a tradeoff for schedule

questions.explanation: Mindset: Never sacrifice quality to meet a deadline. It creates technical debt.
